title: 104_hr3759
content:
The "Exports, Jobs, and Growth Act of 1996" includes amendments to income levels, investment insurance ceiling, and financing ceiling under the Overseas Private Investment Corporation. The "Exports, Jobs, and Growth Act of 1996" includes amendments to investment insurance ceiling, financing ceiling, issuing authority, and policy guidance under the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961. The investment insurance ceiling is increased to $25 billion, financing ceiling to $20 billion, and issuing authority to 2001. Section 235(a)(2)(A) of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to increase the amount from $9.5 billion to $20 billion. Section 235(a)(3) is amended to change the issuing authority year from 1996 to 2001. Section 231 is amended to enhance trade policy guidance. Section 233(b) of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to remove certain sentences, clarify the composition of the Board, and allow the United States Trade Representative to designate a Deputy to serve on the Board. The amendment to Section 233(b) of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 clarifies the composition of the Board by adding a Chairman and Vice Chairman designated by the President. The United States Trade Representative may also designate a Deputy to serve on the Board. TITLE II--TRADE AND DEVELOPMENT AGENCY

SEC. 201. TRADE AND DEVELOPMENT AGENCY AUTHORIZATION.

Amendment to Section 661(f)(1)(A) of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 authorizes $40,000,000 for fiscal 1997 and necessary sums for fiscal year 1998.

TITLE III--EXPORT PROMOTION PROGRAMS WITHIN THE INTERNATIONAL TRADE ADMINISTRATION

SEC. 301. EXPORT PROMOTION AUTHORIZATION.

Amendment to Section 202 of the Export Administration Amendments Act of 1985 authorizes appropriations for export promotion programs. TITLE III--EXPORT PROMOTION PROGRAMS WITHIN THE INTERNATIONAL TRADE ADMINISTRATION

Section 202 of the Export Administration Amendments Act of 1985 is amended to authorize appropriations of $240,000,000 for fiscal year 1997 and necessary sums for fiscal year 1998. TITLE IV--TRADE PROMOTION COORDINATING COMMITTEE

SEC. 401. STRATEGIC EXPORT PLAN.

Amendments to the Export Enhancement Act of 1988 include identifying means for coordinated export promotion services for small- and medium-sized businesses and establishing priorities for promoting US exports and free market reforms in the Middle East to stimulate job growth.

SEC. 402. IMPLEMENTATION OF PRIMARY OBJECTIVES. The Trade Promotion Coordinating Committee is tasked with identifying and eliminating overlap and duplication in Federal export promotion activities, promoting better coordination between State, Federal, and private sector export promotion activities, and including these matters in the annual report by September 30, 1997. SEC. 403. PRIVATE SECTOR DEVELOPMENT IN THE UKRAINE. The Trade Promotion Coordinating Committee will report on efforts to promote US trade and investment for private sector development in Ukraine in the 1997 annual report.
